intro: Agrostophyllum saccatilabium, commonly known as the sac-like labium plant, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, sac-like structures on its labium, which are specialized for attracting pollinators. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
